availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Miller Stout (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier.)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Shelby County, Kentucky, native. Graduated from Harvard College in Cambridge, Middlesex County, Massachusetts, in 1841. Married to Margaret Singleton Stout in 1843. Father of Simpson Stout, Matilda Stout, Stanley S. Stout, Alexander M. Stout, and Emma W. Stout. Attorney in Daviess County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Daviess County in 1850. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Employed Johanna Stapleton as a servant in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel and colonel from October 8, 1861 to January 23, 1865. Wounded at Battle of Shiloh, Tennessee. Brevetted to Brigadier General of Volunteers on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 1.

"Gen. Alexander M. Stout is Dead,"Chicago Tribune(Chicago, IL), August 26, 1895, p.3.
